alert.note: Alert for Custer (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 3:57PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN CUSTER COUNTY THROUGH 430 PM MDT... At 356 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 20 miles southwest of Miles City to 24 miles northwest of Ekalaka. This line was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, nickel size hail, and very heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Garland and Moon Creek Ranch. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
